predicate.note: Frames file for 'assemble' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet classes build-26.1, herd-47.5.2 . Other framed members include arrange, build, grow (26.1), collect (47.5.2).

roleset.name: build

example.name: basic frame, no start/end states
example.text: The Dearborn, Mich., auto maker ran a loss of $37 million on *trace* assembling and marketing cars in the U.S.

example.name: with start state
example.text: John assembles miniature ships out of toothpicks.

roleset.note: Might be hard to get both start and end state in a single example. But who knows?

roleset.name: group

role.descr: theme, thing being included in some group

example.name: no group
example.text: Commodore has assembled an experienced management team.

roleset.note: That could go either way; avoid using Arg2 unless both Arg1 and Arg2 are explicit.

example.name: both theme and group
example.text: John assembled his dirty socks into a formidable (and smelly) pile.
